TRPG.JS

TRPG.JS is a library that can be used to build web-based TRPGs.

What is TRPG?
Tabletop Role-Playing Game, where multiple players need to follow a set of rules, role-play their characters, and go through a story together.

You can use TRPG.JS library to display the information panel for each player, such as attributes, skills, talent tree and inventory, as well as to display events and the possible options or reactions to the events.

Attribute Panel

A panel simply displays the attributes’ names and values.
Try it on Play Ground

Getting Started

HTML:

<div id="attribute-panel"> </div>

JavaScript:

const aPanel = new AttributePanel(
    // first parameter: element ID
    'attribute-panel', {
    // second parameter: configurations
        // required configuration: attribute names and values
        attributes : {
            hp: 1000,
            mp: 500,
            sanity: 'healthy',
            career: 'web developer'
          },
        // optional configurations: description
        description : {
            hp: 'heath point, you will lose health when 
                you eat a rotten apple :)'
        },
        showDescription : true
  });

API Functions

These functions can be used directly without re-rendering the object.
Example: 

aPanel.delete("sanity");
Function Type Usage Example
set(attribute,value) attribute: String , value: String/Number Add or modify an attribute set("life", 13)
delete(attribute) attribute: String remove an attribute delete("life")
setNameColor(attribute, color) attribute: String , color: color code displays the name text of the given attribute in given color setNameColor("hp", "red")
setValueColor(attribute, color) attribute: String , color: color code displays the value text of the given attribute in given color setValueColor("hp", "red")
setDescription(attribute, description) attribute: String , description: String add or modify the discription of an attribute setDescription("life","the game ends when your life goes to 0")
update() - re-render the object update()

Configurations

Function update() is required for the following configurations to be effective.
Example: 

aPanel.showDescription = true;
aPanel.showDescriptionWhenHoverOn = "both";
aPanel.update();
Name Type Default Description
attributes Object {} required for initialization. Format : {attribute_name: attribute_value}
description Object {} the descriptions of each attribute. Format: {attribute_name: attribute_description}
showDescription Bool true enable or disable the ability to show description when hover on the elements
showDescriptionWhenHoverOn "name"/"value"/"both" "name" decide when the user hovers on which elements to display the descriptions
colorChange Bool false enable or disable the ability to change text color when the attribute changes
colorChangeTime Number or "inf" 3 decide the time interval of the text color change
colorChangeColor color code "red" decide the color of the text color change
nameColor color code "black" set the color of all attribute names. This will not overwrite setNameColor function.
valueColor color code "black" set the color of all attribute values. This will not overwrite setValueColor function.
nameTextAlign "left"/"center"/"right" "right" set the alignment of all attribute names
valueTextAlign "left"/"center"/"right" "left" set the alignment of all attribute values

Attribute Bars

Upgrade of the Attribute Panel, displays the attributes in a graphical way.
Try it on Play Ground

Getting Started

HTML:

<div id="attribute-bar"> </div>

JavaScript:

const aBar = new AttributeBars(
    // first parameter: element ID
    'attribute-bar', {
    // second parameter: configurations
        // required configuration: attribute names, values and bar colors
        attributes : {  
            hp: [1000,2000,'pink'],
            mp: [500,800,'rgb(155, 198, 255)']
          },
        // optional configurations: description
        description : {
            hp: 'heath point, you will lose health when 
                you eat a rotten apple :)',
            mp: 'the thing we all need to cast a spell'
        },
        showDescription : true
  });

API Functions

These functions can be used directly without re-rendering the object.
Example: 

aBar.delete("hp");
Function Type Usage Example
set(attribute, value, maxValue, barColor) attribute: String, value: Number, maxValue: Number, barColor: color code add or modify an attribute by inputing the attribute name, current value, max value and bar color set("life", 3, 5, "pink")
delete(attribute) attribute: String remove an attribute delete("hp")
setValue(attribute, value) attribute: String, value: Number modify an existing attribute’s value setValue("life", 1)
setMaxValue(attribute, value) attribute: String, value: Number modify an existing attribute’s max value setMaxValue("life", 100)
setBarColor(attribute, color) attribute: String, color: color code modify the bar color of an attribute setBarColor("life", "red")
setLabelColor(attribute, color) attribute: String, color: color code modify the text label color of an attribute setLabelColor("life", "white")
setDescription(attribute, description) attribute: String, description: String add or modify the description of an attribute setDescription("life", "don't waste it")
update() - re-render the object update()

Configurations

Function update() is required for the following configurations to be effective.
Example: 

aBar.showDescription = true;
aBar.descriptionPosition = "center";
aBar.update();
Name Type Default Description
attributes object {} required for initialization. Format : {attribute_name: attribute_value}
attributesMax object {} required for initialization. Format : {attribute_name: attribute_max_value}
barColor object {} required for initialization. Format : {attribute_name: bar_color}
labelColors object {} the text label color of each attribute, and it overrides the configuration labelColor. Format : {attribute_name: bar_color}
description object {} the description of each attribute. Format: {attribute_name: attribute_description}
showDescription Bool true enable or disable the ability to show desciption when hover on the elements
descriptionPosition "left" or "center" or "right" "center" decide the postion of the description
colorChange Bool false enable or disable the ability to change text label color when the attribute changes
colorChangeTime Number or "inf" 3 decide the time interval of the text color change
colorChangeColor color code "red" decide the color of the text color change
showLabel Bool true enable or disable the abilitiy to display the text label
labelColor color code "black" set the text label color of all attribute names. This will not overwrite setNameColor function.
labelStyle "value/max"or"value"or"%" "value/max" choose which way to display the text label
containerColor color code "rgb(216, 216, 216)" set the overall container’s color
allowExceedMax Bool false allow the current value exceeds the max value numerically

Inventory

A table-like container for players to deal with their items.
Try it on Play Ground

Getting Started

HTML:

<div id="inventory"> </div>

JavaScript:

const myBag = new Inventory(
    // first parameter: element ID
    'inventory', {
    // second parameter: configurations
        // required configuration: item names and quantities
        quantity : { apple: 20,banana: 5,
                   orange: 0,strawberry: 100},
        // optional configurations: description
        description: { apple: 'rotted',
               banana: 'it tastes like a banana' }, 
        // optional configurations: image path
        image: { apple: //path to image here},
        // optional configurations: row number and column number
        numRow: 4,
        numColumn: 6,
        // optional configurations: left click menu options and their onclick event functions
        menuOption: ['use','destroy'],
        menuOptionOnclick: { 'use': use_item,
         'destroy':  destroy_item,}  
});

API Functions

These functions can be used directly without re-rendering the object.
Example: 

myBag.addItem("apple", 10);
Function Type Usage Example
set(item, quantity, description, image_path) item: String, quantity: Number, description: String, image_path: String add or modify an item set("blueberry", 20, "my favourite", "image/blueberry.jpg")
setQuantity(item, quantity) item: String, quantity: Number modify an item’s quantity setQuantity("blueberry, 100)
setDescription(item, description) item: String, description: String add or modify an item’s description setDescription("blueberry", "I don't like it any more")
setImage(item, image_path) item: String, image_path: String add or modify an item’s image icon setImage("blueberry", "image/trashBin.jpg")
addItem(item, quantity) item: String, quantity: Number add an item by quantity addItem("banana", 10)
removeItem(item, quantity) item: String, quantity: Number remove an item by quantity removeItem("blueberry", 20)
clearItem(item) item: String remove all of the given item removeItem("blueberry")
setOption(options) options: Array set a list of options on the left click menu for each item setOption(["eat", "play", "wash"])
addOption(option) option: String add an option on the left click menu addOption("drink")
addOptionClick(option, func) option: String, func: a function takes item's name as input add or modify an option’s onclick event function addOptionClick("eat", eat_item), where we can define function eat_item(item) { myBag.removeItem(item, 1); }
removeOptionClick(option) option: String remove an option from the left click menu removeOptionClick("wash")
update() - re-render the object update()

Configurations

Function update() is required for the following configurations to be effective.
Example: 

myBag.showDescription = true;
myBag.update();
Name Type Default Description
quantity object {} quantity for each item, required for initialization. Format : {item_name: item_quantity}
description object {} description for each item. Format : {item_name: item_description}
image object {} image path for each item. Format : {item_name: item_image_path}
numRow Number 5 number of rows
numColumn Number 5 number of columns
showName Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display item names when hover on any item
showDescription Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display item descriptions when hover on any item
showQuantity Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display quantity label
showOnclickMenu Bool TRUE enable or disable the ability to display onclick menu when left click on any item
menuOption Array [] the list of options on the left click menu
menuOptionOnclick object {} the onclick functions of each option. The onclick function will be stored even if the option is not in menuOption array.
optionFontSize Number in px 20 the font size of options on the left click menu
itemSize Number in px 50 the width and height of each item
quantityFontSize Number in px 18 the font size of the quantity text label
quantityXPosition "left"/"center"/"right" "right" the horizontal position of the quantity text label
quantityYPosition "top"/"center"/"bottom" "bottom" the vertical position of the quantity text label
